examples.sentence: That oaf spilled milk all over my new Huawei laptop.
Don't be such an oaf - these porcelain teacups are from the Ming Dynasty!
Medieval villagers believed oafs were changelings left by fairies.
The oafish waiter spilled soup on three customers in a row.
His oafish grin made everyone suspect he'd forgotten his pants again.
The oafish pumpkin won first prize in the ugly vegetable contest.
The witch's oafish fingers twisted like tree roots.
His oafish behavior at the meeting included microwaving fish.

examples.sentence: Robin Hood's hideout was in an ancient oak tree.
Acorns falling from the oak startled the foraging squirrel.
The whisky aged in oak barrels developed vanilla notes.
This Tudor-style house features exposed oak beams.
The oak door with iron hinges weighed over 200kg.
His oak desk had carvings of Norse mythology.
This oak-aged balsamic vinegar costs Â¥888 per bottle.

examples.sentence: The oaken barrel aged the whiskey for 12 years.
He knocked on the oaken door with a dragon-shaped knocker.
The exhausted oarsman collapsed after rowing across the Yangtze River.
Ancient oarsmen in dragon boats used drumbeats to synchronize strokes.
As lead oarsman, he sets the rhythm like a metronome.
The camel caravan finally reached an oasis with date palms after 10 days in the Gobi Desert.
Scientists discovered a hidden oasis under Antarctica's ice with ancient microorganisms.
This teahouse is an oasis of tranquility amidst Beijing's hutongs.
Her book-filled study became my mental oasis during the quarantine.
The rooftop garden is an urban oasis for office workers to recharge.

examples.sentence: Oat milk latte has become the new favorite in Starbucks China.
She sprinkles roasted oats on her yogurt like snowfall.
The oat field in Inner Mongolia sways like a golden ocean.
Wind turbines stand among oat fields in Shanxi province.
The fisherman lost an oar in the storm and had to paddle with his hands.
Traditional dragon boat oars are decorated with lucky red patterns.
As the strongest oar in the team, he sets the rhythm for others.
The cox shouted at the tired oars to keep rowing.
Grandma's giant oar for stirring mooncake filling looks like a boat paddle.
The brewery uses special oars to mix the malt in open vats.
We oared leisurely across the West Lake at sunset.
The crew oared in perfect unison during the final sprint.
She oared the small boat through the lotus flowers with practiced ease.
The gondolier oared the romantic couple along Venetian canals.
My mother-in-law always sticks her oar in when we're disciplining the kids.
Don't put your oar in others' relationship matters.
After winning the first round, the team shouldn't rest on their oars.
The CEO warned staff not to rest on their oars despite record profits.
The doctor took the Hippocratic oath under the witness of Apollo's statue.
Breaking the oath of knighthood would stain his family's honor forever.
She placed her hand on the Bible while taking the oath in court.
The witness was charged with perjury for violating his oath.
The pirate's colorful oaths could make even sailors blush.
He muttered an oath when stubbing his toe on the Great Wall bricks.
New citizens take the oath of allegiance holding little red books.
The CEO testified under oath about the company's mooncake accounting.

examples.sentence: I mix oatmeal with yogurt for a quick breakfast.
This cookie recipe calls for two cups of oatmeal.
British detectives always eat oatmeal with milk in TV dramas.
Grandma's secret to perfect oatmeal is a pinch of salt.
Starbucks' oatmeal raisin cookie pairs well with Americano.
College students survive on instant oatmeal during finals week.

teach: ç‡•éº¦ç‰‡æ˜¯æ—©é¤ç•Œçš„ä¸‡é‡‘æ²¹ğŸ”§ï¼è‹æ ¼å…°äººæ‰“ä»—éƒ½å¸¦ç€ç‡•éº¦è¢‹ğŸ´ï¼Œè¯´'ä»Šå¤©åƒåœŸ'è‹±è¯­å«live on oatmealï¼ˆé ç‡•éº¦è¿‡æ´»ï¼‰ã€‚æ­é…ç§˜ç±ï¼šè±ªåç‰ˆåŠ åšæœğŸŒ°+èœ‚èœœğŸ¯ï¼Œæ‡’äººç‰ˆç›´æ¥æ³¡å¥¶èŒ¶ğŸ¥¤ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼šè¯´'å¯¡æ·¡æ— å‘³'å¯ä»¥åæ§½tastes like plain oatmealï¼

examples.sentence: The Scottish highlands are perfect for growing oats.
Oats waving in the wind look like golden waves.
Grandma's secret is adding cinnamon to her oats.
Instant oats with pickles is my pandemic survival meal.
His motorcycle phase was just sowing wild oats.
The obduracy of my grandpa refusing to use smartphones is legendary in our family.
Her obduracy in sticking to traditional teaching methods frustrated the students.
With the obduracy of a toddler wanting ice cream, he kept requesting spicy hotpot.
The negotiation failed due to the obduracy of both parties.
The obduracy of the landlord evicting the sick old man shocked the neighborhood.
Historical records reveal the obduracy of some emperors executing loyal ministers.
The obdurate toddler refused to eat anything green, even broccoli-shaped chocolates.
His obdurate belief that the earth is flat survived three astronomy classes.
She was obdurate about using only fountain pens in the digital age.
The obdurate programmer insisted on coding in Assembly language.
The landlord's obdurate response to the plea was to double the rent.
An obdurate winter wind cut through our thin jackets.
The cat's obdurate refusal to use the $200 designer pet bed went viral.
Not even puppies could melt his obdurate heart.
The military dog showed absolute obedience to commands with one raised eyebrow.
The AI assistant's obedience to human orders may evolve unpredictably.
Panda cub's obedience to its keeper often ends when bamboo is involved.
Her obedience to fashion trends disappeared after discovering vintage clothing.
The ancient sword was buried with its owner as a symbol of eternal obedience.
Golden retrievers are famous for their obedience that even overrides food temptation.
The cult demanded blind obedience that even included giving up bubble tea.
In obedience to traffic laws, the e-bike rider reluctantly wore the safety helmet.
The military dog remained obedient even with steak dangling before its nose.
AI assistants are programmed to be obedient to voice commands.
The obedient clay yielded to the potter's skilled hands.
Tourists obediently followed the red flag through the crowded alley.
The obedient son massaged his mother's shoulders after her square dancing session.
She's known as the most obedient daughter-in-law in the mahjong circle.
Citizens should be obedient to traffic laws as pandas to bamboo.
The panda obediently rolled over when the keeper gave the command.
She obediently switched to green tea after the doctor's warning.
The dog sat obediently at the crosswalk, waiting for the light to change.
Tourists obediently queued in single file to enter the Terracotta Army museum.
Ducklings follow obediently behind their mother like living cotton balls.
The knights made obeisance by touching their helmets.
In the Forbidden City, officials performed obeisance like folding paper fans.
Japanese salarymen's 90-degree obeisance resembles falling dominoes.
The ballet dancer's obeisance was as fluid as a swan bending its neck.
WeChat emoji packs show obeisance to traditional zodiac culture.
His obeisance to elders was reflected in serving tea with both hands.
Manga artists pay obeisance to Akira Toriyama by drawing Saiyan hairstyles.
The Peking opera performer made deep obeisance that stirred his feather crown.
The Washington Monument is the world's tallest marble obelisk.
Ancient Egyptian obelisks were often covered in hieroglyphs like giant stone tweets.
The obelisk symbol (â€ ) is used in footnotes like a tiny sword stabbing the page.
In recipes, an obelisk may mark substitute ingredients like a culinary warning sign.
Medieval scribes used double obelisks (â‘) to express doubt, like ancient emoji.
The obscure obelisk in this manuscript probably means 'this translation is dodgy'.
The sunset created an obelisk of light between the skyscrapers.
The panda at the zoo is adorably obese, rolling like a fuzzy black-and-white boulder.
Fast food chains are contributing to the obese population in urban areas.

teach: obeseå…¶å®æ˜¯'æ¬§Â·æš´é£Ÿ'ğŸ”ï¼å¤ç½—é©¬è´µæ—ç”¨ob-å‰ç¼€è¡¨è¾¾'è¿‡åº¦'ï¼ˆæ¯”å¦‚obsceneæ·«ç§½çš„ï¼‰ï¼Œæš´é¥®æš´é£Ÿå°±ä¼šå˜æˆ'è¡Œèµ°çš„æ±¤åœ†'ğŸ¡ã€‚è¯´äººèƒ–è¦å§”å©‰å¯ç”¨'plus-size'ï¼ˆåŠ å¤§ç ï¼‰ï¼Œçˆ†æ¢—è¯´æ³•æ˜¯'built for comfort not for speed'ï¼ˆä¸ºèˆ’é€‚ä¸ä¸ºé€Ÿåº¦æ‰“é€ ï¼‰ğŸ·ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼šobeseæ¯”fatæ›´å­¦æœ¯ï¼Œä½†æ¯”'è‚¥å®…å¿«ä¹ä½“'æ®‹é…·ï¼

examples.sentence: The panda's adorable obesity comes from eating 20kg bamboo daily.
Childhood obesity can be reduced by cutting sugary drinks.
Office workers often develop abdominal obesity from sitting too long.
Pandas obey their keepers only when bamboo is involved.
The AI assistant obeys voice commands like a digital butler.
All drivers must obey traffic lights, even at 3am.
WeChat mini programs obey strict privacy regulations.
Cats rarely obey their owners' calls unless hungry.
The robot vacuum obediently obeys its scheduled cleaning routine.
Soldiers must obey without question in emergencies.
The self-driving car failed to obey when encountering a chicken crossing.
Delivery riders obey navigation orders even leading to dead ends.
Bicycle-sharing users should obey parking laws.
The villain obfuscated the surveillance camera with black spray.
Thick fog obfuscated the neon signs of Hong Kong.
The politician obfuscated the truth with 10,000-word speeches.
Some apps deliberately obfuscate their user agreements.
The escape room designer obfuscated clues with red herrings.
AI-generated comments can obfuscate real public opinion.
Debaters who can't win often obfuscate the issue.
The teacher's explanation only added obfuscation to the math problem.
Political speeches are often full of deliberate obfuscation.
The artist used smoke to create visual obfuscation in the photo.
The fog caused complete obfuscation of the road signs.
The contract's fine print was a masterpiece of deliberate obfuscation.
The museum displays obituary notices from the Tang Dynasty.
His WeChat feed suddenly filled with obituary posts during the pandemic.
The Peking University published an obituary for the renowned mathematician.
Tech giants now use AI to generate obituaries automatically.
Newspaper obituary columns are becoming digital memorials.
The museum displayed a mysterious bronze object from Sanxingdui.
Her desk was cluttered with sticky-note covered objects.
The object of this game is to collect all mahjong tiles.
Finding true love was the ultimate object of her journey.
In 'I eat hotpot', 'hotpot' is the direct object.
Many netizens objected to the new social media policy.
She objected that the meeting time conflicted with lunch break.
Grandma objects to ordering takeout every day.
Money is no object when it comes to bubble tea addiction.

teach: objectæ˜¯ä¸ªç²¾ç¥åˆ†è£‚çš„å•è¯ğŸ§ ï¼ä½œåè¯æ—¶åƒä¹–å·§çš„å®¾è¯­ï¼ˆgrammarå¯¹è±¡ï¼‰ï¼Œä½œåŠ¨è¯ç§’å˜æ ç²¾ï¼ˆobjectæ„è§ï¼‰ğŸ’¢ã€‚å¤ä»£æ³•åº­æ‰”(object)é™¶ç½è¡¨ç¤ºåå¯¹âš–ï¸ï¼Œç°ä»£ç¨‹åºå‘˜æŠŠä¸‡ç‰©éƒ½çœ‹ä½œå¯¹è±¡ï¼ˆOOPï¼‰ğŸ’»ã€‚è¯´'åšå†³åå¯¹'å¯ä»¥ç”¨strongly object like rejecting cilantroğŸŒ¿ï¼Œ'ç›®æ ‡æ˜ç¡®'è¯´with the clear object of...åƒç„å‡†ç«é”…é‡Œçš„æ¯›è‚šğŸ¯

examples.sentence: The objectification of emotions in AI research remains controversial.
Buddhism teaches the objectification of desires to attain enlightenment.
Marx discussed the objectification of labor in capitalist systems.
The objectification of women in advertisements has sparked heated debates.
Scientists objectify emotions by measuring brain waves.
The museum exhibit objectifies ancient rituals with 3D holograms.
Some advertisements objectify women as decorative objects.
Stop objectifying programmers as coding machines!
The novel objectifies the city as a living creature.

teach: objectifyå°±åƒå®éªŒå®¤çš„æ ‡æœ¬ç“¶ğŸ§ªï¼šæŠŠæŠ½è±¡æ¦‚å¿µå˜æˆå¯æµ‹é‡çš„æ•°æ®å›¾è¡¨ğŸ“Šï¼ˆä¸­æ€§ç”¨æ³•ï¼‰ï¼Œä½†ç”¨åœ¨äººèº«ä¸Šå°±å˜æˆæ©±çª—é‡Œçš„å‡äººæ¨¡ç‰¹ğŸ‘—ï¼ˆè´Ÿé¢ç”¨æ³•ï¼‰ã€‚æ­é…ï¼šobjectify emotionsï¼ˆé‡åŒ–æƒ…æ„Ÿï¼‰/objectify relationshipsï¼ˆç‰©åŒ–å…³ç³»ï¼‰ã€‚åæ§½'æŠŠäººå½“å·¥å…·'å¯ä»¥è¯´treat sb. like a vending machineğŸ¤‘

examples.sentence: The lawyer raised an objection when the witness started gossiping.
Your objection sounds like a rejected WeChat voice message.
She registered her objection to working overtime by bringing a sleeping bag.
The environmental group has no objection to the solar power plan.
The biggest objection to this app is its battery consumption.
My mom's only objection to my boyfriend is his love for durian.
The HR manager listed three objections to my job application.
His objection to adopting a cat was actually severe allergies.
Customers can make an objection within 7 days after purchase.
I have no objection to eating hotpot three times a week.

teach: objectionå°±åƒæ³•åº­å‰§é‡Œçš„'æˆ‘åå¯¹ï¼'ğŸ‘¨âš–ï¸ æœ€æ—©æŒ‡å¤ç½—é©¬äººå¾€æ•Œäººé˜µåœ°æŠ•æ·(ject)çŸ³å—(ob)çš„å¯¹æŠ—è¡Œä¸ºğŸ—¡ï¸ã€‚è¦è¯´'å¼ºçƒˆåå¯¹'å¯ä»¥å–Š'I take exception to that!'ï¼ˆæ¯”åœŸæ‹¨é¼ å°–å«ä¼˜é›…ï¼‰ã€‚æ­é…ï¼šsustained objectionï¼ˆæœ‰æ•ˆå¼‚è®®ï¼‰/ frivolous objectionï¼ˆæ— ç†å–é—¹ï¼‰ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼šæ¯ä¸ªobjectionéƒ½æ˜¯æ€æƒ³ç¢°æ’çš„ç«èŠ±ğŸ’¥ï¼

examples.sentence: The proposal contains several objectionable clauses about overtime.
His objectionable comments on Weibo triggered massive backlash.
The restaurant's objectionable smell of durian drove customers away.
That pink polka-dot tie is absolutely objectionable!
Douyin automatically filters objectionable content.
Our objective is to make dumplings fly to Mars by 2050.
The secret objective of this meeting is to decide the lunch menu.
In 'I love you', 'you' is in the objective case.
Museum displays historical objectives behind glass.
The AI gave an objective analysis of the spicy hotpot controversy.
Journalists should remain objective when reporting on pineapple pizza debates.
'Whom' is the objective form of 'who'.
We finally achieved the objective of inventing self-stirring tea cups.
The panda gave an objective evaluation of bamboo quality across provinces.

teach: objectiveå°±åƒç„å‡†é•œğŸ¯ï¼å½“åè¯æ—¶æ˜¯ä½ è¦å‡»ä¸­çš„ç›®æ ‡ï¼ˆæ¯”å¦‚å¹´åº¦KPIï¼‰ï¼Œå½“å½¢å®¹è¯æ—¶æ˜¯'ä½›ç³»'çŠ¶æ€ğŸ§˜â€”â€”åƒAIè£åˆ¤çœ‹è¶³çƒèµ›âš½ï¼Œä¸å¸¦æ„Ÿæƒ…è‰²å½©ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼š'ä¸»è§‚'æ˜¯subjectiveï¼ˆå¸¦ä¸ªäººæ»¤é•œï¼‰ï¼Œ'å®¢è§‚'æ˜¯objectiveï¼ˆåƒ360Â°æ‘„åƒå¤´ï¼‰ã€‚è¯´'ä¿æŒå®¢è§‚'å¯ä»¥åæ§½ï¼šDon't be a Karenï¼ï¼ˆåˆ«å½“æ ç²¾ï¼‰

examples.sentence: The AI analyzes your selfie objectively like a mirror, not like your mom who always says you're handsome.
Judges should evaluate spicy hotpot objectively, though tears may blur their vision.
We should look at NFT artworks objectively as digital assets, not magic lottery tickets.
The journalist maintained objectivity while reporting the hot pot restaurant scandal.
Objectivity is harder when judging your mom's cooking.
Virtual reality blurs the line between subjectivity and objectivity.
The objectivity of dinosaur extinction has been confirmed by fossil evidence.
The AI's objectivity in grading essays exceeded human teachers.
Bubble tea reviews should balance personal taste and objectivity.
The paper on spicy hotpot lacked scientific objectivity.

teach: objectivityæ˜¯'ä½›ç³»ä¸‰ä»¶å¥—'ğŸ§˜â™‚ï¸ğŸ“âš–ï¸ï¼š1) å†å²æ¢—ï¼šæºè‡ªæ‹‰ä¸è¯­'objectum'ï¼ˆæ‰”åœ¨å‰é¢çš„ä¸œè¥¿ï¼‰ï¼Œåƒæ³•å®˜é¢å‰çš„æ³•æ§ŒğŸ‘¨âš–ï¸ï¼›2) è§†è§‰åŒ–ï¼šæƒ³è±¡ç”¨å·å°ºé‡å¥¶èŒ¶ç”œåº¦ğŸ“ï¼Œä¸å—'çç å¤šå°±æ˜¯å¥½'å½±å“ï¼›3) æ­é…ï¼šmaintain objectivityï¼ˆä¿æŒå®¢è§‚ï¼‰/lose objectivityï¼ˆå¤±å»å®¢è§‚ï¼‰ï¼›4) åœ°é“è¯´æ³•ï¼š'ä¸å¸¦æ„Ÿæƒ…'å«without biasï¼Œå°±åƒç«é”…è˜¸æ–™ä¸æ”¾é¦™èœğŸŒ¿

examples.sentence: The environmental objectors chained themselves to trees to protest the construction.
In every office meeting, there's always that one objector who says 'but what if...'
The conscientious objector refused military service for moral reasons.
As the only objector in the voting group, she had to prepare a 10-page dissent report.
During WWII, conscientious objectors often worked as ambulance drivers instead.
The contract obligates ByteDance to provide annual physical exams.
Chinese law obligates children to support elderly parents.
The typhoon obligated all flights to be cancelled at Pudong Airport.
His injury obligated him to quit the esports competition.
Her donation of 2000 N95 masks obligated the whole community.
The firefighter who saved the cat obligated its owner with tears.
Doctors are obligate reporters of infectious diseases.
Pandas are obligate bamboo-eaters in the wild.
We're obligated to scan health QR codes when entering malls.
I feel obligated to help my neighbor carry groceries up to the 6th floor.
Walking your dog is both a joy and an obligation.
In China, filial obligation includes visiting parents during holidays.
Teachers have an obligation to report bullying incidents.
Wearing masks became a social obligation during the pandemic.
The contract imposes legal obligations on both parties.
Cultural traditions often carry unspoken obligations.
I feel an obligation to return the favor after his help.
In Chinese culture, receiving red packets creates obligation.
Student loan obligations weigh heavily on graduates.
The company failed to meet its financial obligations.
Doctors are under obligation to maintain confidentiality.
Helping elderly neighbors is a moral obligation, not a law.
Wearing masks became obligatory during the pandemic, like underwear for your face.
It's obligatory for Jedi knights to protect the weak, but they never teach you how to deal with midichlorian taxes.
The obligatory 'I'm fine' when your mom video calls you at 3am.
Adding boba to milk tea is now obligatory in Taiwan, like oxygen to humans.
The obligatory 5-minute standing ovation at North Korean concerts.
In Japan, taking shoes off is as obligatory as breathing, unless you're Godzilla.
The law obliges parents to send their kids to school.
The contract obliges us to finish the project before Mid-Autumn Festival.
She obliged the lost tourist by guiding him to the subway station.
The billionaire obliged the village with a new school building.
I'm much obliged for your WeChat red packet during quarantine.
We'd be obliged if you could reschedule the meeting.
The old man always obliges by fixing bicycles for free.
Real friends oblige without being asked.
Could you oblige by passing the chili sauce?
He obliged by livestreaming the panda birth for his followers.
We're obliged to show health QR codes everywhere now.
She felt obliged to correct the misleading douyin video.

teach: obligeæ˜¯'é“å¾·ç»‘æ¶ç»³'ğŸ§¶å’Œ'äººæƒ…ä¿¡ç”¨å¡'ğŸ’³çš„ç»“åˆä½“ï¼å¤ç½—é©¬ç”¨ligareï¼ˆæ†ç»‘ï¼‰çº¦æŸäººğŸ¤µï¼Œç°åœ¨è¯´'Much obliged'å°±åƒæ‹±æ‰‹ä½œæ–ğŸ™ã€‚è¦åæ§½è¢«è¿«æ‰«ç æ—¶è¯´'We're obliged to scan'ï¼Œè¡¨è¾¾æ„Ÿæ¿€ç”¨'I'm obliged for the bubble tea'ğŸ§‹ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼šç»³å­ç»‘å¤ªç´§ä¼šæ–­ï¼Œäººæƒ…ç”¨å¤ªå¤šä¼šçƒ¦ï¼

examples.sentence: I'm much obliged for your WeChat red packet during quarantine.
She felt obliged when her neighbor shared toilet paper.
Doctors are obliged to treat patients regardless of payment.
As a citizen, I feel obliged to wear masks in public.
You're not obliged to scan every QR code you see.
Foreigners are obliged to show passports when booking hotels.
Chinese hosts feel obliged to overfeed their guests.
"Much obliged!" said the tourist when I helped with his Alipay.

examples.sentence: The obliging shopkeeper helped grandma choose the softest tofu.
Tourists love the obliging pandas that pose for selfies.
His obliging nature made him bring homemade dumplings to the office.
The obliging waiter noticed my chopsticks struggle and brought a fork.
Japanese service staff are famously obliging to foreign guests.
The obliging child offered his seat to the pregnant lady on the subway.
The flight attendant's obliging smile eased my turbulence anxiety.
Her obliging nature makes her the most popular ayi in the neighborhood.
The street vendor obligingly gave directions while roasting sweet potatoes.
She obligingly switched to Mandarin when noticing my poor English.
The oblique bamboo shadows danced on the white wall.
Photographers love oblique lighting for portrait shots.
She gave an oblique answer about her salary.
The novel contains oblique criticism of bureaucracy.
The oblique business deal smelled like corruption.
Avoid oblique methods when applying for visas.
Ancient Chinese roofs were built at precise oblique angles.
His speech made oblique references to recent scandals.

teach: obliqueå°±æ˜¯èŒåœº'æ­ªè„–å­æ ‘'ğŸŒ´ï¼ç‰©ç†ä¸Šåƒæ¯”è¨æ–œå¡”ğŸ•ï¼ˆoblique towerï¼‰ï¼Œè¯´è¯åƒå¾®ä¿¡è¯­éŸ³60ç§’æ–¹é˜µğŸ—£ï¸ï¼ˆoblique answersï¼‰ï¼Œåšäº‹åƒèƒèŸ¹æ¨ªç€èµ°ğŸ¦€ï¼ˆoblique methodsï¼‰ã€‚è®°ä½ï¼š'æ–œçœ¼çœ‹äºº'å«cast an oblique glanceï¼Œ'æ‰“å¤ªæ'å°±æ˜¯give oblique responsesã€‚ä½ çš„è€æ¿å¯èƒ½æ­£åœ¨obliquelyè¯„ä¼°ä½ å“¦ï¼

examples.sentence: The Eiffel Tower photo was taken obliquely from a hot air balloon.
Cut the tofu obliquely to create diamond-shaped pieces.
The Leaning Tower of Pisa stands obliquely at 3.97 degrees.
During the earthquake, bookshelves began to lean obliquely.
She hinted obliquely about the surprise party by mentioning 'unexpected gatherings'.
The diplomat answered obliquely to avoid political sensitivity.
The influencer promoted products obliquely without proper disclosure.
He obtained the information obliquely through backdoor channels.
The novel refers obliquely to historical events through metaphors.
